docs.snippet: Visitors to Washington can explore more than two centuries of African-American history and culture with a new guide that includes information on 98 sites in the city. The sites are listed as part of 15 neighborhood walking or driving tours in the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Visitors to Washington can explore more than two centuries of African-American history and culture with a new guide that includes information on 98 sites in the city. The sites are listed as part of 15 neighborhood walking or driving tours in the guide, ''African American Heritage Trail, Washington, DC,'' that are accompanied by maps, photographs and brief historical sketches. Among the places are Cedar Hill, the home in Anacostia that Frederick Douglass bought, breaking the ban against nonwhite ownership; Howard University, the oldest historically black college in the United States, founded in 1867; and the newly renovated Lincoln Theater, first opened in 1922, where Duke Ellington (a Washingtonian), Pearl Bailey, Lionel Hampton, Ella Fitzgerald and Billie Holliday performed.
docs.abstract: New guide to Washington, DC, features information on 98 sites in city dedicated to African-American history and culture; photo (M)

headline.main: Washington Has Guide To Black Heritage Sites

docs.snippet: THREE months after a Liberian-registered oil tanker foundered off the coast of Pembrokeshire in west Wales, sending more than 70,000 tons of oil into the water and onto the shores of some of Britain's most spectacular beaches, life in the stricken...
docs.lead_paragraph: THREE months after a Liberian-registered oil tanker foundered off the coast of Pembrokeshire in west Wales, sending more than 70,000 tons of oil into the water and onto the shores of some of Britain's most spectacular beaches, life in the stricken region is beginning to return to normal. The huge oil slicks that snaked through the water in the weeks after the spill, at the tip of Milford Haven harbor, are mostly gone now, as are the daily sights of oil-soaked seabirds washing up on shore. There are few outward signs in villages along the shore that the region was recently the scene of the worst oil spill in its history.

headline.main: West Wales Recovering From Huge Oil Spill
